thread.title: Artists to see at Luminaria 2015 -
thread.title_full: Artists to see at Luminaria 2015 - San Antonio Express-News

author: Jim Kiest
title: Artists to see at Luminaria 2015 -
text:
Photo: Jim Kiest Image 1 of / 14 14 Chrysta Bell: S.A. native Bell, a one-time member of Austin band 8 1/2 Souvenirs, has relocated to the West Coast, where she's become a frequent collaborator with filmmaker David Lynch. Luminaria will be her first hometown performance in more than 10 years. Chrysta Bell: S.A. native Bell, a one-time member of Austin band 8 1/2 Souvenirs, has relocated to the West Coast, where she's become a frequent collaborator with filmmaker David Lynch. Luminaria will be ... more Photo: Jim Kiest Image 2 of 14 Woonhak Chung: Korean artist's works often combine classical Buddhist themes with light and color.
Woonhak Chung: Korean artist's works often combine classical Buddhist themes with light and color. Photo: Jim Kiest Image 3 of 14 Ronnie Cramer: Cult filmmaker, experimental musician and artist Cramer will screen "SA," an animated tour of the Alamo City made from thousands of watercolor paintings.
Ronnie Cramer: Cult filmmaker, experimental musician and artist Cramer will screen "SA," an animated tour of the Alamo City made from thousands of watercolor paintings. Photo: Jim Kiest Image 4 of 14 Neuzz: Street artist from Mexico City will create a new mural during Luminaria.
Neuzz: Street artist from Mexico City will create a new mural during Luminaria. Photo: Jim Kiest Image 5 of 14 Andro-Ray: Mysterious party robot is the alter-ego of young San Antonio musician and artist Ray Torres.
Andro-Ray: Mysterious party robot is the alter-ego of young San Antonio musician and artist Ray Torres. Photo: Jim Kiest Image 6 of 14 The Bolos: S.A. band is a throwback to the kind of psychedelic garage rock compiled on the classic album "Nuggets." Their latest is the EP "Mercy."
The Bolos: S.A. band is a throwback to the kind of psychedelic garage rock compiled on the classic album "Nuggets." Their latest is the EP "Mercy." Photo: Jim Kiest Image 7 of 14 Stephen O'Malley: Guitarist O'Malley, best known as a member of the doom metal band Sunno))), will perform a one-time-only solo set at 9 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 24, at The Ten Eleven.
Stephen O'Malley: Guitarist O'Malley, best known as a member of the doom metal band Sunno))), will perform a one-time-only solo set at 9 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 24, at The Ten Eleven. Photo: Jim Kiest Image 8 of 14 Femina X: Self-described "avant garde electronic soul" band features Daniela Riojas on vocals and Pop Pistol's Alex Scheel on synthesizer and guitar.
Femina X: Self-described "avant garde electronic soul" band features Daniela Riojas on vocals and Pop Pistol's Alex Scheel on synthesizer and guitar. Photo: Jim Kiest Image 9 of 14 Miguel Gutierrez: Insightful, provocative choreographer and dancer Gutierrez brings "Age & Beauty: Part 1 – Mid-Career Artist/Suicide Note or &:-/, " which was commissioned by the Whitney Biennial, to Luminaria. Miguel Gutierrez: Insightful, provocative choreographer and dancer Gutierrez brings "Age & Beauty: Part 1 – Mid-Career Artist/Suicide Note or &:-/, " which was commissioned by the Whitney Biennial, to ... more Photo: Jim Kiest Image 10 of 14 Margarita Cabrera: Former Artpace artist in residence Babrera, who lives in El Paso, explores border issues in her work, including hand-crafted sculptures of mechanical objects.
Margarita Cabrera: Former Artpace artist in residence Babrera, who lives in El Paso, explores border issues in her work, including hand-crafted sculptures of mechanical objects. Photo: Jim Kiest Image 11 of 14 John Hernandez: San Antonio artist Hernandez, another Artpace alum, makes colorful, surreal works that looks something like a Big Daddy Roth hot rod crashing into Pepperland. He's building a giant robot for Luminaria.
John Hernandez: San Antonio artist Hernandez, another Artpace alum, makes colorful, surreal works that looks something like a Big Daddy Roth hot rod crashing into Pepperland. He's building a giant robot for ... more Photo: Jim Kiest Image 12 of 14 Siyon Jin: Korean artist known for his work with light will project "Flow" onto the facade of the San Antonio Museum of Art. A dancer will perform in front of the light projection.
Siyon Jin: Korean artist known for his work with light will project "Flow" onto the facade of the San Antonio Museum of Art. A dancer will perform in front of the light projection. Photo: Courtesy, Siyon Jin Image 13 of 14 OUI Danse: New York-based company -- pronounced "We Dance" -- founded by French choreographer Brice Mousset will present a new work, "Urbountry," commissioned for Luminaria.
OUI Danse: New York-based company -- pronounced "We Dance" -- founded by French choreographer Brice Mousset will present a new work, "Urbountry," commissioned for Luminaria. Photo: Rosalie O'Connor, Starz TV Image 14 of 14 Artists to see at Luminaria 2015 1 / 14 Back to Gallery This year's installment of the city's annual contemporary arts festival runs Oct. 23-24 along Jones Avenue from the San Antonio Museum of Art to Maverick Park.
More than 50 artists – dancers, musicians, muralists, poets, filmmakers and more – will present new works during the festival. Here's a sampling:
